faq.answer_1: As Raak is <Link>open-source</Link>, you can already run Raak yourself without waiting for access. However, we advice most of you to wait for the private beta around Nov/Dec 2024. If you are really enthusiastic, please reach out to us for access to Raak during private alpha.
faq.answer_2: If you are also building open-source software, you can use Raak Pro for free! Please <Link>reach out to us</Link> with a repository link to get started quickly.
faq.answer_3: Linear is amazing: their design and sync engine are aspirations for Raak. That said, Raak is focused on small companies with a single, product-oriented team. A simple page view captures all tasks and issues, even if you manage multiple apps.
faq.answer_4: Though Pivotal Tracker (2006) is <Link>shutting down</Link>, it still is a very effective way to communicate tasks. Raak is heavily inspired by Pivotal Tracker. Yet, we also do things differently: no comments nor notifications (only inline mentioning if enabled). A modern design, more granular editing, table view and dark mode.
faq.answer_5: There will be no chat or comments in Raak itself. Rather, we will research how to best embed Raak into your existing workflow with tools such as Slack, Discord and/or Github.
faq.answer_6: For fans of Pivotal Tracker we have good news. An import script for Pivotal Tracker - including attachments - is already in the works. If you have very large projects in Pivotal Tracker, please <Link>contact us</Link> to see if we can collaborate on more advanced migration options.
faq.question_4: A short comparison with Pivotal Tracker
pricing.text_1: Ideal if you are just getting started.
pricing.text_2: For those that have multiple apps in production.
subtitle: in a single view.
text_1: Raak is an issue tracker for small teams that build & maintain multiple apps. Open-source, built for speed & fun.
text_2: Many great tools exists, but they are biased towards large teams. We built Raak for ourselves to easily track development work across multiple apps.
text_3: Best-in-class OS libraries that fit well together. Each with proper documentation.
text_4: Powerful - yet optional - integrations so you can focus on customer needs.
text_6: Simple pricing. One invoice per year. Free access until Raak is out of beta.
text_7: Raak is in private alpha. Here's what we can share now. A changelog will be added soon.
why.text_1: Raak has a clear goal: to make the managing of tasks in small development teams super efficient and fun.
why.text_2: Ship new features and fixes faster. Leverage automation around label management, code references and quick screenshots.
why.text_3: All tasks are stored locally for instant search and fast updates. Changes are synced as you get back online.
